sections.text:
RCW 62A.2A-107

Waiver or renunciation of claim or right after default.

Any claim or right arising out of an alleged default or breach of warranty may be discharged in whole or in part without consideration by a waiver or renunciation in a signed record delivered by the aggrieved party.

Any claim or right arising out of an alleged default or breach of warranty may be discharged in whole or in part without consideration by a waiver or renunciation in a signed record delivered by the aggrieved party.

[ 2023 c 266 s 303; 1993 c 230 s 2A-107.]

Construction—Effective date—2023 c 266: See notes following RCW 62A.12-101.

Construction—Effective date—2023 c 266: See notes following RCW 62A.12-101.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

RCW 62A.2A-107

Waiver or renunciation of claim or right after default. (Effective until January 1, 2024.)

Any claim or right arising out of an alleged default or breach of warranty may be discharged in whole or in part without consideration by a written waiver or renunciation signed and delivered by the aggrieved party.

Any claim or right arising out of an alleged default or breach of warranty may be discharged in whole or in part without consideration by a written waiver or renunciation signed and delivered by the aggrieved party.

[1993 c 230 § 2A-107.]

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

Any claim or right arising out of an alleged default or breach of warranty may be discharged in whole or in part without consideration by a waiver or renunciation in a signed record delivered by the aggrieved party.

Any claim or right arising out of an alleged default or breach of warranty may be discharged in whole or in part without consideration by a waiver or renunciation in a signed record delivered by the aggrieved party.

[ 2023 c 266 § 303; 1993 c 230 § 2A-107.]

Construction—Effective date—2023 c 266: See notes following RCW 62A.12-101.

Construction—Effective date—2023 c 266: See notes following RCW 62A.12-101.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

RCW 62A.2A-108

Unconscionability.

(1) If the court as a matter of law finds a lease contract or any clause of a lease contract to have been unconscionable at the time it was made the court may refuse to enforce the lease contract, or it may enforce the remainder of the lease contract without the unconscionable clause, or it may so limit the application of any unconscionable clause as to avoid any unconscionable result.(2) If a party claims that, or it appears to the court that, the lease contract or a clause within the contract may be unconscionable, the court shall allow a reasonable opportunity to present evidence as to the lease or clause's commercial setting, purpose, and effect to aid the court in making the determination.

(1) If the court as a matter of law finds a lease contract or any clause of a lease contract to have been unconscionable at the time it was made the court may refuse to enforce the lease contract, or it may enforce the remainder of the lease contract without the unconscionable clause, or it may so limit the application of any unconscionable clause as to avoid any unconscionable result.

(2) If a party claims that, or it appears to the court that, the lease contract or a clause within the contract may be unconscionable, the court shall allow a reasonable opportunity to present evidence as to the lease or clause's commercial setting, purpose, and effect to aid the court in making the determination.

[1993 c 230 s 2A-108.]

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.
